verses.verse: A Psalm of David, <S%H1732><s%> Maschil. <S%H4905><s%> Blessed <S%H835><s%> is he whose transgression <S%H6588><s%> is forgiven, <S%H5375><s%> whose sin <S%H2403><s%> is covered. <S%H3680><s%>

Blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man <S%H120><s%> to whom the LORD <S%H3068><s%> imputes <S%H2803><s%> not iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and in whose spirit <S%H7307><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> guile. <S%H7423><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> I kept <S%H2790><s%> silence, <S%H2790><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> waxed old <S%H1086><s%> through my roaring <S%H7581><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long.

For day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> was heavy <S%H3513><s%> on me: my moisture <S%H3955><s%> is turned <S%H2015><s%> into the drought <S%H2725><s%> of summer. <S%H7019><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

I acknowledge <S%H3045><s%> my sin <S%H2403><s%> to you, and my iniquity <S%H5771><s%> have I not hid. <S%H3680><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> I will confess <S%H3034><s%> my transgressions <S%H6588><s%> to the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> and you forgave <S%H5375><s%> the iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of my sin. <S%H2403><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

For this <S%H2063><s%> shall every <S%H3605><s%> one that is godly <S%H2623><s%> pray <S%H6419><s%> to you in a time <S%H6256><s%> when you may be found: <S%H4672><s%> surely <S%H7535><s%> in the floods <S%H7858><s%> of great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> they shall not come <S%H5060><s%> near <S%H5060><s%> to him.

You are my hiding <S%H5643><s%> place; you shall preserve <S%H5341><s%> me from trouble; <S%H6862><s%> you shall compass <S%H5437><s%> me about with songs <S%H7438><s%> of deliverance. <S%H6405><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
I will instruct <S%H7919><s%> you and teach <S%H3384><s%> you in the way <S%H1870><s%> which <S%H2098><s%> you shall go: <S%H3212><s%> I will guide <S%H3289><s%> you with my eye. <S%H5869><s%>

Be you not as the horse, <S%H5483><s%> or as the mule, <S%H6505><s%> which have no <S%H369><s%> understanding: <S%H995><s%> whose mouth <S%H5716><s%> must be held <S%H1102><s%> in with bit <S%H4964><s%> and bridle, <S%H7448><s%> lest <S%H1077><s%> they come <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> to you.
Many <S%H7227><s%> sorrows <S%H4341><s%> shall be to the wicked: <S%H7563><s%> but he that trusts <S%H982><s%> in the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%> shall compass <S%H5437><s%> him about.

Be glad <S%H8056><s%> in the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and rejoice, <S%H1524><s%> you righteous: <S%H6662><s%> and shout <S%H7442><s%> for joy, all <S%H3605><s%> you that are upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart. <S%H3820><s%>
